data.title: Attending DT Summer Nights? You Could Be on Film or in Pictures
meta_keywords: the morning news with dave and lance
data.meta_description: The hot weather has everyone looking for shade and water and you'll find all that at the Final Downtown Summer Nights happening in downtown Yakima tonight.
data.text:
The hot weather has everyone looking for shade and water and you'll find all that at the Final Downtown Summer Nights happening in downtown Yakima Thursday.

A SMALL CHANGE IN VENUE TO KEEP YOU COOL

But to help you stay cool there's a small change. Officials at the Downtown Association of Yakima say the event will be held just around the corner at the new Rotary Pavilion Market Place at 15 West Yakima Avenue from 6:00 pm to 9:00 pm.

Get our free mobile app

THE MOVE IS REACTION TO THE HEAT WAVE HITTING THE VALLEY

The association Director Curt Wilson says "the reason for the move was to ensure that the public can safely attend our final Downtown Summer Night event of the summer during this heat wave. We are thankful for MultiCare Memorials flexibility and willingness to provide early access to their parking lot, amongst other things.”

IF YOU ATTEND YOU COULD BE ON FILM OR IN PICTURES

If you attend tonight you're encouraged to drink lots of water all day to hydrate yourself tonight. Association officials say a film production crew will be working at the event this evening filming a specific group of people as they enjoy food, drink and the music.

So remember if you attend you may appear in pictures and videos taken at the site Thursday.

YOU'LL GET LOTS OF WARNINGS ABOUT THE SPOTLIGHT

A press release says signs will be "posted and an announcement will be made notifying the public that by entering the area and attending the event, they are acknowledging that they have been informed that they may be photographed and recorded. Any individual or group not wanting to be filmed, or have their photo published, should not attend the event."

Get our free mobile app

Report a typo or correction

Got a news tip? Email us here.

25 True Crime Locations: What Do They Look Like Today?

Below, find out where 25 of the most infamous crimes in history took place — and what the locations are used for today. (If they've been left standing.)

50 Most Popular Chain Restaurants in America

YouGov investigated the most popular dining brands in the country, and Stacker compiled the list to give readers context on the findings. Read on to look through America's vast and divergent variety of restaurants—maybe you'll even find a favorite or two.

LOOK: 50 songs you won't believe are turning 50 this year

From classic rock anthems to disco hits and everything in between, Stacker surveyed Billboard's Hot 100 list of top songs in 1973 and highlighted the top 50.

Check Out the Best-Selling Album From the Year You Graduated High School

Do you remember the top album from the year you graduated high school? Stacker analyzed Billboard data to determine just that, looking at the best-selling album from every year going all the way back to 1956. Sales data is included only from 1992 onward when Nielsen's SoundScan began gathering computerized figures.

Going in chronological order from 1956 to 2020, we present the best-selling album from the year you graduated high school.

The Best Country Singer From Every State

Some states, like Oklahoma and Texas, are loaded with famous country singers. Others, like Nevada and Maine, are still looking for a real breakthrough artist. See the best and most successful country music artist from all 50 states, starting with Hank Williams and Alabama.
